result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Allen McLean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: To be paid during the terms of probation.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 02:49 PM Thomas Allen McLean, defendant appeared in Court via zoom from Tellurian, Inc. with counsel Michael Shannon Murphy in the court room and via zoom. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. The parties have a joint recommendation. Defendant freely and voluntarily waives his right to appear in person today. Plea Questionaire filed and reviewed with defendant via zoom. Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found. No Contest plea entered on count #1. The court accepts the joint recommendation and finds the defendant guilty on count #1. Count #2 will be dismissed and read in.
Clerk gave Attorney Murphy NOH as he was in Branch 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Thomas Allen McLean, defendant does not appear in Court. Attorney Michael Shannon Murphey not in court. Matt Lantta appeared as prosecuting attorney on behalf of Laura Kohl. Attorney Lantta informed the court the defendant has covid. Attorney Lantta requests matters be scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
